q: Eric Schmidt said in an interview with a Swiss magazine on Thursday. Asked about the high valuations being put on companies such as social network company Facebook and game developer Zynga, Eric Schmidt said in an interview with Bilanz: There are clear signs of a bubble... But valuations are what they are. People believe that these companies will achieve huge sales in the future. This is true... valuations were what they were in 1999 as well. Until they were not. Lead Google; Roles Clarified by Staff Larry Page, who co-founded Google with Sergey Brin , will be the U.S. search-engine giant's chief executive officer in April, the company announced Thursday. In this new role I know he will merge Google's technology and business vision brilliantly, Eric Schmidt , the company's current CEO, said in a blog posted on Google's Web site.
